result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jaidion D Echols

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Firearm Safety Course

Defendant Jaidion D Echols in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Jaidion D Echols.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.
Defense counsel informed the Court that this case is now in Deferred Prosecution Agreement posture.
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
Court vacates the 10/19/2022 Jury Trial. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jaidion D Echols in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court canceled the stayed bench warrant based on defendant's appearance in court this date.  Defense has provided state with additional information.   Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 37.  All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jaidion D Echols in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for status. 
Court advises the Defendant that prior counsel has left the Public Defender's office and new counsel has not yet been appointed. 
Court orders matter adjourned for a status of counsel. Case remains calendared in Br. 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jaidion D Echols in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jaidion D Echols appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Parties are negotiating.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with the location 4641 N. 27th Street.

Defendant Jaidion D Echols in court.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/21/22 @ 1:30p
